fields.description:
Bullet lists are one of the nice new features of confluence 1.1. But they are working only for the first cell or I have no idea how cat it be done.

Here's wiki sample:
|| Name || Value ||
|| A list |
* Item 1
* Item 2
* Item 3
* Item 4 |
|| A list 2 | more tags
* Item 1
* Item 2
* Item 3
* Item 4 |
fields.summary: cannot create 2nd bullet list inside the table cell

fields.description:
When running Confluence locally, the browser is often faster than the server - redirects get you back before the transaction has been committed, leading to nasty errors when you're trying to view a page that hasn't yet been created.

Solution: in the xwork redirect result, commit any existing txn manually _before_ sending back the redirect.
fields.summary: Redirect sometimes faster than previous txn commit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1383].
  {panel}

Add a drop-down (or radio?) list to the create-space screen:

Space Security:

* I will set my own custom permissions for this space
* Registered users may view this space
* Registered users may view and comment in this space
* Registered users may view, comment in and edit in this space
* Anyone may view this space
* Anyone may view and comment in this space
* Anyone may view, comment in and edit this space.
* Use same permissions as another space:

(1) would leave the default "only creator has perms"
(2-4) give permissions to "confluence-users"
(5-7) give permissions to "Anyone"

If last one is selected, activate a space drop-down.
fields.summary: Add permission schemes drop-down to "create space"

fields.description:
This bug is a duplicate of CONF-1328, but 1328 is marked for Post 1.1 and I'm concerned that this might not be addressed for a while.

In short, the issue is that notifications don't work for us; the body of the message is empty.  See CONF-1328 for the relevant stack trace.
fields.summary: Notifications are missing content

fields.description:
At the moment users can't create macro libraries that contain custom images inside the JAR, they must put the images into the web application separately which is cumbersome. 

See http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Custom+Java+Macros?showComments=true#comment-4836 for more details and some design thinking.
fields.summary: Allow macro libraries to include web-served resources

fields.description:
When a use have the permission of modify space,she can delete all the page of the space.

How about separate the permission of modify space. Let a use can add page and edit page of one space but she can't delete a page of that space?
fields.summary: How about more complex permission?

fields.description:
Formats error when English words and Chinese words on the same lines.

When the first word of the line is English and the second word is Chinese,Confluence will add a CRLF after the English words.
for example:

"English中文"

will format to :

English 
中文

and """English" will have the good format.
fields.summary: Formats error when English words and Chinese words on the same lines

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1373]. {panel} {panel:title=Atlassian Status as of June 27, 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa} Hi all, I'm pleased to let you know that we now support searching in Persian and Arabic. This improvement is available to Server and Data Center customers in Confluence 6.10.0 - check out the [Release Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-6-10-release-notes-952058221.html] for more information. Although we've investigated it, we're currently unable to deliver this improvement for Hebrew. Unfortunately there are currently no suitable libraries with the correct licensing available to us. To follow the progress of search for Hebrew, please watch: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-55859 We haven't at this point looked into the editing of RTL languages. If this is something you're interested in having supported, please vote on: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-55860 Many thanks Jenny Millman | Product Manager, Confluence Server {panel}   Original request: {quote}We would like to have support for Hebrew (RTL language) both in search and editing within documents as well. {quote} This would include: * support for changing text direction in the editor * proper rendering of RTL text on Confluence pages * support for text containing paragraphs or phrases with text in different directions (RTL and LTR) * indexing and searching support for RTL languages. h3. Workaround It is possible to [create a user macro|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Writing+User+Macros] in Confluence to support inserting blocks of RTL text and displaying them properly. Ask your Confluence administration to define a new {{rtl}} user macro with the following contents, and an output format of HTML: {code:java} #set($globalHelper=$action.getHelper()) #set($renderer=$globalHelper.getWikiStyleRenderer()) #set($context=$content.toPageContext()) #set($renderedContent=$renderer.convertWikiToXHtml($context, "${body}"))
${renderedContent}
{code} This can be used in the editor to indicate and properly format blocks of RTL text. For Confluence 4.0 and higher, the following Macro needs to be used, as with the removal of wiki markup, the conversion from wiki to XHTML is no longer necessary. Make sure {{Rendered}} is selected as the Macro Processing option. {code:java} ## @noparams
${body}
{code}
fields.summary: Support RTL languages (e.g. Hebrew, Arabic, Persian) for editing and searching

fields.description:
When Confluence is installed with a non-empty context URL (e.g. http://servername/confluence) then the links to older versions of attachments don't have the context name in their URLs, resulting in a 404 error. The link to the current versions of attachments are correct.

Simply attach the same file twice and you cannot download the older version anymore.
fields.summary: Links to older versions of attachments don't include the webapp context

fields.description: Indexing a space that contains unicode content seems to work properly but search for a such this contents returns no result. it seems all unicode queries are not encoded properly(one byte gets omitted for each character).
fields.summary: Unicode queries  in quick search don't have any results

fields.description:
Pages that contain "Unicode" encoded text cause an error. the complete error stack trace can be found in issue CONF-1296.
It must be said that this error was not seen in 1.0.3
fields.summary: Unicode Page export error

fields.description:
There appears to be a regression in the way {include} and {children} macros interact in 1.1.  If I include a page that uses a {children} macro, the {children} macro appears to expand to the children of the page that has the {include} macro, not the included page.

See attached space export to help reproduce.

Note: previous version that works that I tested was 1.0.2.
fields.summary: Wrong interaction between include and children macros

fields.description:
After upgrading from 1.0.3a to 1.1.0 and fixing the mail configuration, we are gettting emails again.  However, the notifications (from Watch this Page/Space) are empty.  The subject line is correct but there is no corresponding body.

This may only be happening with HTML emails, I didn't check with text-based emails.
fields.summary: Email notifications are blank

fields.description:
Displaying space summary results in an SQLException (see below) even though there are no visible problems with the page. I've increased priority to this bug to "Critical" because I cannot assess if there are other parts of Confluence code that will have the same problem with DB2 so feel free to reduce priority. From DB2 trace it appears that this exception is caused by some seriously broken SQL statement that looks like

<quote>
select * from ( 
      rownumber() over(order by content.LASTMODDATE desc
    ) as row_,   SELECT content.CONTENTID as CONTENTID0_, content.CONTENTTYPE as CONTENTT2_0_, content.TITLE as TITLE0_, content.BODY as BODY0_, content.VERSION as VERSION0_, content.CREATOR as CREATOR0_, content.CREATIONDATE as CREATION7_0_, content.LASTMODIFIER as LASTMODI8_0_, content.LASTMODDATE as LASTMODD9_0_, content.PREVVER as PREVVER0_, content.SPACEID as SPACEID0_, content.PARENTID as PARENTID0_, content.BLOGSPACEID as BLOGSPA13_0_, content.DESCSPACEID as DESCSPA14_0_, content.PAGEID as PAGEID0_, content.USERNAME as USERNAME0_ from CONTENT content, SPACES
                 where (content.SPACEID = SPACES.SPACEID or
                       content.BLOGSPACEID = SPACES.SPACEID or
                       content.DESCSPACEID = SPACES.SPACEID)
                 and SPACES.SPACEKEY = ?
            order by content.LASTMODDATE desc
     ) as temp_ where row_ <= ?
</quote>

Here is the exception

fields.description:
It would be nice to put line breaks in the table format, but these line breaks wouldn't show up in the rendered page.  Perhaps this can be done with the following syntax: The last character on the line is a single \ and there are non-special chars directly before it.  For example

{noformat}
|cell 1,1| cell 2,1\
|cell 3,1|
|cell 1,2| cell 2,2\
|cell 3,2|
{noformat}

This would be rendered as a 2 row 3 column table.  Putting line breaks in the table definition is nice if I'm trying to get the definition cells to line up.

I suppose this is a general need for all of the syntax.  Because line breaks mean something to the renderer would be nice to be able to escape them.
fields.summary: line breaks in table syntax

fields.description:
Attachments links are rendered with the ^ symbol still in it.

Eg. [^WAS5.1-responsefile.txt] is rendered into ^WAS5.1-responsefile.txt
fields.summary: Links to attachments includes the ^ symbol

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to render attachments as HTML (at least some types like Word docs, excel sheets and PDFs)  It should also have a possibility of saving these rendered files as a regular confluence page.
fields.summary: Attachment rendering

fields.description:
I'm evaluating Confluence for our team and upgraded yesterday from 1.0.3b to 1.1. Everything worked fine but today I wondered about not having gotten an email from confluence. So I opened the Administration to control the mailserver properties and there I got an exception with the following information. I have to mention also that all the mails me and my colleagues got before with 1.0.3b were always completely empty. Therefore I wondered wether we would have the same phenomenon with 1.1 also.

Cause:

fields.description:
When CamelCase page linking is enabled confluence has trouble parsing urls that have camel case words in the query part of the url.

However when camel case is disabled, then the link is parsed and rendered properly.

For example the following url:
* [Simple Code Sharing Document   |http://engineroom.gfinet.com/jive/appl/postDetail.jsp?postName=SimpleCodeSharing&spaceName=EnterpriseProcess]
fields.summary: Url containing CamelCase words are not parsed properly

fields.description:
Thank you for the WebDAV support!  

Is it possible to pass the user to the underlying WebDAV user so the user owns the folder and files created.  This will allow the a user protect their attachments.

Some thoughts on how to do this:

1. Assumption: webdav session is less than conf session
2. When user logs in to conf, their credentials are passed to webdav, establishing a session on server.
3. Any requests for attachment uses the established session (if the session terminates, either terminate the user's session or prompt to login again.

This wouldn't work for the remember me functionality :{

The other option is to cache the credentials in memory and reuse those credentials everytime the user needs access to the WebDAV server.  Perhaps encrypt the passwords with a random key (persisted for the length of the vm or longer) so they're not floating out in the open.

Also, a mechanism for opening the document through webdav might be desireable as well.  An edit button on the attachment page that opened the document through webdav (Microsoft Office will allow the user to save the content back to the server).
fields.summary: WebDAV support pass-thru permissions

fields.description:
PDF exports do not contain images in Confluence 1.1. The same behavior can be seen in confluence.atlassian.com, for example go to

http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/exportpage.action?pageId=4389

and try to export the page in PDF format - no image is present in the PDF.

The following exception is printed in the log for each image in the export:

[ERROR] Error while creating area : Error while recovering Image Informations (file:/xxx/confluence/database-xxx/temp/export_06092004_155634/sizes.png) : /xxx/confluence/database-xxx/temp/export_06092004_155634/sizes.png (No such file or directory)

I checked the export folder and indeed when exporting PDF or HTML version of a page the files aren't written to the export folder.

The images are displayed normally in the web views though.
fields.summary: Page exports do not contain images

fields.description:
This has probably changed since 1.0.

When creating horizontal line it used to be using the ---- tag. To do it in 1.1 I need to use ----- . In the Guide, theres written it shoudl be ---- so update the documentation or update the program. But its not mission critical :)
fields.summary: Creating horizontal line requires 5x - instead of 4x -

fields.description:
New with version 1.1 the pipe character ('|') can't be used in list items anymore; it causes a line break. But it can be used in normal paragraph text. The following example: * Use a | inside a list item. is rendered as:
  • Use a
| inside a list item.

Note that escaping the pipe character works.
fields.summary: Cannot use pipe character in list items

fields.description: The horizontal ruler notation, ---- (four consecutive dashes on a line), doesn't work anymore.  The characters are rendered as is.  See http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEST/TextBreakTestPage for an example.
fields.summary: horizontal ruler notation broken

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1322].
  {panel}

It would be very useful if the Confluence Wiki markup supported HTML definition lists (i.e. the <dl>, <dt>, <dd> elements).  This is supported by other Wikis as for example JSPWiki, TikiWiki, and Meatball Wiki.

The proposed markup syntax would be:

;term one: definition of term one.
;term two:longer definition of
term two.

This would result in:

<dl>
 <dt>term one</dt>
 <dd>definition of term one.</dd>
 <dt>term two</dt>
 <dd>longer definition of
term two.</dd>
</dl>

An alternative syntax would be:

*;term:definition
fields.summary: Support for definition lists

fields.description: This issue pertains to version 1.1-dev Build:#52 Jun 08, 2004. With prior releases of Confluence it used to be possible to link to pages with apostrophes in the title. Example (taken from http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEST/Apostrophe%27s+page): [Link to self|Apostrophe's page] This isn't possible anymore. With version 1.1 this is rendered as: [Link to self|Apostrophe's page] with results in the entered text with a redish background color. Escaping the apostrophe with a leading backslash doesn't seem to help either. If this new behaviour is intentional it should be documented in the notation guide. But I'm hoping it is a bug :-)
fields.summary: Cannot link to pages with apostrophe in title

fields.description:
Pertains to 1.1-dev build #52.

When in the Page History of an older version is selected (i.e. clicking on a link in the first column [e.g. "v. 1"]), then the user is required to be logged in.  After logging in the message "Not Permitted" and "You are not permitted to perform this operation." is displayed.

Is there a new permission in Confluence?  If that is the case then not allowing registered users to view older versions is an inappropriate default, as this even applies to versions which the user himself created.  Further note that diffing two page versions is allowed.
fields.summary: not permitted to view previous versions of page

MietteitÃƒÂƒÃ‚ÂƒÃƒÂ‚Ã‚ÂƒÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â‚ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚ÂƒÃƒÂƒÃ‚ÂƒÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â‚ÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â‚ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚ÂƒÃƒÂƒÃ‚ÂƒÃƒÂ‚Ã‚ÂƒÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â‚ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â‚ÃƒÂƒÃ‚ÂƒÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â‚ÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â‚ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚ÂƒÃƒÂƒÃ‚ÂƒÃƒÂ‚Ã‚ÂƒÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â‚ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚ÂƒÃƒÂƒÃ‚ÂƒÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â‚ÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â‚ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â‚ÃƒÂƒÃ‚ÂƒÃƒÂ‚Ã‚ÂƒÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â‚ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â‚ÃƒÂƒÃ‚ÂƒÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â‚ÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â‚ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚ÂƒÃƒÂƒÃ‚ÂƒÃƒÂ‚Ã‚ÂƒÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â‚ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚ÂƒÃƒÂƒÃ‚ÂƒÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â‚ÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â‚ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚ÂƒÃƒÂƒÃ‚ÂƒÃƒÂ‚Ã‚ÂƒÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â‚ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â‚ÃƒÂƒÃ‚ÂƒÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â‚ÃƒÂƒ

fields.description:
Would it be possible to change the HTML layout so that if the content area of the page is wider than the currently expected width, the page tools on the right side of the page wouldn't be scaled? Right now the page scales quite well but when wide images are put to a page, the page toolbox shrinks so that it's hard to use. I guess it might be fixed by simply stating a minimum width to the box?

I created a sample page here:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEST/Wide%2Bpage

Current behavior is consistent at least when using Safari and Camino (Mozilla 1.7 rendering engine).
fields.summary: Horizontally scalable layout

fields.description:
This is due to the fact that the mail queue still currently checks the old mail queue implementation (MailQueueImpl) and hasn't been updated to check the mail queue stored in a generic TaskQueue and managed by the TaskManager (pleaser refer to EMailNotifier class)

Consequence:
Mail Queue in Admin section does not work. Does not display queue items and hence cannot flush.
fields.summary: Mail queue not updated with queued notification items

fields.description:
On rare occasions when the setup wizard finishes, it redirects the user to the login page (instead of straight into Confluence which is the expected behaviour since the admin user is logged-in in the admin setup step).

Entering the admin password entered in the setup step does not appear to work either. Attemtping to retrieve the password throws the exception below.

Still looking for a reliable way to reproduce this error.

fields.description:
I understand from Benoit D'Oncieu that the default database definition used by Confluence uses long names for tables / columns.

As Confluence uses Hibernate, it should be possible to change the Hibernate mapping file to use different table and column names without impacting the code. I can't find any reference to this in the Confluence manual, but is this something we can do under the terms of the licence? If so, where do I find details on how to do this?

If we successfully deploy on the Z/OS box with DB/2 we will set up our database in advance. How would we then prevent Confluence trying to create the database schema on first run?
fields.summary: DB2 on mainframe does not support long names

fields.description: This was part of the fix so that disabled users no longer contributed to the user total, but it's slowing down anything that needs to count the active users by massive amounts when you've got a lot of users registered. We need a more efficient way of marking a user as disabled.
